website_summaries.verdict: Black ballpoint ink pens that are comfortable in the hand, and practical for everyday use. Rubber grips make them a good choice for writers with hand issues.
pros: Feature soft, rubber grips that make them extremely comfortable to hold and easy to control
Barrels are transparent so you can see ink levels
cons: Ink occasionally builds up on the tips, resulting in smears and streaks

customer_reviews.title: Comparison ( I can’t believe someone compared these same 3 pens but in a different way)
customer_reviews.text: Received 3 packs of pens as a gift, giving me the opportunity to compare the Uniball, Pilot G2 Gel roller, and the Zebra “z grip”.You can see in the photo that the Zebra and the Uniball come out looking about the same, with the Pilot writing the darkest.The photo showing a “blank” page is how the pens show up through the paper - only the darker Pilot is slightly visible.
customer_reviews.author: P. Heaphy

customer_reviews.title: Pen of Champions
customer_reviews.text: The highlight of these Zebra Z-Grip pens is definitely the quality of the ink. Surprisingly so smooth and after writing I swiped my finger across the ink and it was already dry. He ink doesn't bleed which means these pens will last a very long time. Another thing is the metal clip which is great for durability! The no slip grip is a plus of course especially when needing to scribble something down fast! What I love the most though is the look of the pen, nice and sleek, not bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lemme tell ya, Zebra Pens are the only pens you need
customer_reviews.text: You know the saying "When you hear hooves, think horses, not zebras?" Well I'm here to tell you that when it comes to pens, forget all about that. It's ALL ABOUT THE ZEBRAS. Best pens on the market for the price, bar none. They are literally the only pens I ever buy. Fantastic quality, durability, and longevity. They write fantastically smooth and dry quickly. You will not be disappointed. Trust me, I'm a random person on the internet.
customer_reviews.author: Dan K

customer_reviews.title: They stop writing mid stroke
customer_reviews.text: These pens had great reviews and a great price but they dont work! They stop writing midstroke and I have to draw a mad squiggle to get the ink flowing again, but then it doesnt want to write over the failed letters. It's hard to explain, but basically they don't work.
customer_reviews.author: Archer

customer_reviews.title: SERIOUSLY!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on the reviews. Now Thinking these r fake reviews. These pens r awful. Basically all of them don’t write. U need to prep them by getting them to write on a scratch paper then they barely write after all that. They r a piece of garbage. Really, I think these reviews r fake. Who would even spend the time to write a good. review of pens anyway. These r so bad I’d think buyers would be mad enough to write a review .
customer_reviews.author: June

customer_reviews.title: Great pens...
customer_reviews.text: For the price , these cannot be beat. I have been using these pens for months now. I'm on my 2nd pen. I have many more to use before I need to buy more. They write smoothly and the ink flows consistent. Each pen is protected with a little plastic cap to ensure they won't dry out before use. Zebra always makes quality pens. These are no different. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bros

customer_reviews.title: Good value pens but quality control not consistent
customer_reviews.text: These are nice pens for the price. The ink is smooth and is easy to hold and right. Only issue so far is that a few of the pens have faded ink even though it is no where near empty. Trying to shake the pen or write out circles to get the ink flowing again did not work. Unfortunately those pens had to be thrown out. This has happened to 2 out of 10 pens so far.
customer_reviews.author: amazonshopper

customer_reviews.title: Ink blops build up at the tip
customer_reviews.text: The first pen I tried, bits of goop built up near the tip and smeared on the paper. Next pen same thing. Third pen same thing. 4th pen same thing. Amazon gave a full refund and said I could keep the pens which I promptly threw in the trash. Even for free they are not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: JD_in_SB

customer_reviews.title: Don't throw your money away
customer_reviews.text: I work in extreme conditions, and in a very hot desert climate, and I like these type of pens because I have arthritis in my hands and they write the easiest for me but there is no other brand that seems to work in this climate other than the most expensive three brands of this type of pen. And these don't work at all here, so now I have a bunch of pens that I can't even use. Wish they did work, but they don't, so in this case saving a little bit of money is not going to help you here, just spend more money and get a better pen that works.
customer_reviews.author: Shane A. Tebo

customer_reviews.title: CRAP
customer_reviews.text: This is the crappiest pen I've ever used. Whether it's right from the box or been used multiple times, you have to scribble a bunch to start writing with it. But that's not all, you have to periodically stop what you're writing to shake it and/or scribble because the pen cuts out for no apparent reason. Ridiculous for a brand new pen and I've tried several of them by now. Calling this pen smooth is a complete and utter lie; false advertisement. I also noticed from the beginning that you need to put a lot of pressure on these pens to write with black, rather than the faded gray you get from writing with a lighter hand.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie M

customer_reviews.title: Start to write very faintly after 1 day use
customer_reviews.text: These pens work fine for the first day of use. After that, the pen starts writing very faintly (even though the ink reservoir is more than 3/4 full). I will not be buying ever again. In fact, I now have to buy another container of pens (from different company) because these are not efficient. Don't buy these, save yourself a headache.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Moore

customer_reviews.title: don't purchase if you want a pen that writes in  BOLD letters
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this gel pen thinking it would have a bold/wide writing point . Not so. Although it is marked as having a "medium" point, it actually has a very scratchy "fine" type point. Not for you if you want to leave a bold -point message. Also not for you if you don't want to write with a gen pen that is scratchy and annoying in its scratchiness. It certainly isn't for me. I will just give them away to less discerning, less "picky" writers than myself (lol) & find some other brand at an office supply store.. That way I can at least try them before I buy them. They are not worth the effort required to return them.
customer_reviews.author: an honest review

customer_reviews.title: Save your money and pass on these cheapo pens
customer_reviews.text: just an Average pen..even less than average... I get better pens for free from my bank. When I pick it up, it won't write until I scribble on something. Feels and writes like a cheap pen. Not particularly smooth. I'm going to an office supply and buy and actual good Nice Writing pen cause these ain't it. All these great reviews ?? well, it's a pen. And it writes. But it doesn't do it particularly well. Some have said the reviews are "faked up" to some degree. Sure looks that way to me.. Save your money on these and just take the free pen at the bank...It's better
customer_reviews.author: thorn3686

customer_reviews.title: Horrible pen
customer_reviews.text: Nice design and feel, lousy ink delivery. Constant skipping. I thought it was the paper I was using, but then I tried dedicated note paper with the same effect. Considering throwing the whole lot out.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Writes great-smooth. Excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: These are great pens. I love gel pens but sometimes you need a regular ink pen...legal docs ,checks etc. I love the smoothness of how these pens write. They don't skip. I also o ke the clicker rather than just a cap. I tend to get ink on my clothes with those because they stay open all the time and /or the cap gets lost. Lastly the price for this many pens is great. I share with the whole house and keep a few in desks,drawers, briefcases etc. Thease would be good stocking stuffers. I always try to find little things besides just candy to put in stockings!
customer_reviews.author: Dontmesswithtx

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed =(
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in these pens. I've been through 4 now and they all make extremely narrow lines and skip....ALOT! They look and feel like a fine point pen (which I did not want) and they do not make smooth lines. I will write a few words and think, o.k. here we go it is working, and then the skipping begins. They almost feel like they are going to tear the paper if I press too hard. Then, when I lighten up they stop marking/writing at all. Don't waste your money on these.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Needs
customer_reviews.text: these pleasantly surprised me. $7 for 24. so it's like 30 cents each. Kind of better than the bic 5 to 10 cent each blue pens that are the least fancy. they give off ink better than those bic, cheaper ones. although i'm sure bic has some fancy ones too. for "zebra" brand (whatever the f that is), they were pretty good. next, i want to try the pilot g-7 blue pens, but "extra fine". and see how they compare. (fine and bold are way too ink leaky for me).
customer_reviews.author: G4 B.

customer_reviews.title: These pens do not work well.
customer_reviews.text: These pens are not good pens. Every time I go to use one, I have to scribble a little bit to get it to start working. I waited too long to start using them, so it is too late to send them back. Don’t buy them. I’m really sorry so many of them come in the package. So now I have a bunch of pins that do not work well.
customer_reviews.author: Pam V.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Pens!
customer_reviews.text: I very often look for a pen that is easy to hold, smooth to write with, and makes my handwriting look great. This pen does all of those things! The grip makes it comfortable and easy to hold and the ballpoint tip is extra smooth and makes everything you write look great. It also helps that these pens are professional and good looking! I put them in a cup on my desk and they match great with everything else. I would definitely recommend these pens to anyone looking for a reliable, everyday pen.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Huber

customer_reviews.title: Pens write well... when they write!
customer_reviews.text: There is some kind of coating on the points when much be written or scratched off before being able to write. I also find some pens just suddenly stop writing. You must then find scrap paper to make circles so it starting workig again. Moments later the same thing happens. I'm going to return mine.
customer_reviews.author: Quality/Value Consumer

customer_reviews.title: DRY BALLS, SAVE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would feel it necessary to write a review about pens, but these piss me off everyday. I realized by all the little scribbles in my checkbook and other places I write regularly that these pens are an epic fail. The balls dry out in a day so the need to be jarred back to life, so 5 months into this I surrendered and tossed them into the trash where they belong. Its been maddening!
customer_reviews.author: Leeto

customer_reviews.title: Wont write on half the paper surfaces I have
customer_reviews.text: The pens are great as far as grip goes, but the ink won't write on anything that has even the SLIGHTEST slip to it. If the paper is glossy at all - or if it is regular and you've rubbed your hand over it too much, the pen won't write. I won't buy them again
customer_reviews.author: RagTagVoodooBoy

customer_reviews.title: Just don't last very long
customer_reviews.text: My late mother used to receive pens from charities that she would donate to. Not all of them, but some wrote better than these pens. You have to get them started inking after not being used since the prior day. In a surprisingly short amount of time, the ink flow becomes patchy at best. Yes, they are cheap, but probably not worth it,as they start sputtering real quickly. The old,slobbering bic pens that leaked in my pocket lasted forever.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this pen when you need smooth for quick, efficient, reliable writing!
customer_reviews.text: It’s true- the Zebra pen is the smoothest pen ever!! As a nurse, I go through a LOT of pens. And smoothness matters, because nothing’s more frustrating than a pen ink-skipping as you’re trying to document quickly so you can get to the next patient who needs your help. I remembered the Zebra striped pen from several years ago when I discovered it at work, and then ordered this new version of it and it is even BETTER than I remembered!!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Michele Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I'll use these until I run out and will go back to the Sarasa Clip
customer_reviews.text: I got these because they were cheaper than the 0.5 Sarasa clips that I love and figured I would try these out since they were cheaper. I'll go back to the clips after I use these. The 0.5 on this pen writes a little thicker compared the clip and other brands. The worst part about these are the little wax balls you must take off. No matter how much you get off it seems some is still left on causing the pen to skip. Not for me
customer_reviews.author: Pray90

customer_reviews.title: Best pen ever
customer_reviews.text: These are the only pens I use and are good for everyday use. Anyone that uses my pen complements the smooth writing and comfortable grip. I've given many away and later find the people I've given these to have kept it for a long period of time and still love it. I buy the big packs because the clip often breaks due to my constant fidgeting but the ink itself lasts up to 3-4 months with heavy daily use.
customer_reviews.author: incutech

customer_reviews.title: Terrible and don't write well.
customer_reviews.text: These are extremely poorly made pens. They don't work well at all. I tried them all and they all have trouble with marking on paper. You would think they were out of ink. I work in restaurants and need these for my guest to sign their checks. The last reason you want to get no tip is because the pens are crap. Absolutely do not buy these. Im too lazy to return and too cheap to throw them away, so I guess I'll just force them to work somehow. Im not taking them to work though.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: They're 'alright'..
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I wanted a handful of these type of pens, not because I was looking for something super duper fancy and great. These fit that description perfectly for me. They write pretty well and as expected for what they are. The ink does kinda "clump" after use and sitting though. But again, you shouldn't be expecting something that costs this much and comes in this quantity to perform like a pen that costs at least this much, if not more, for just one!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Terrible - every pen has problems with ink flow
customer_reviews.text: These pens are quite atrocious. On the outside they feel nice, but when writing almost every time the ink is blocked/stuck with every pen. So I sit there and scribble for a minute or so everytime I want to write something. A headache. A basic Bic pen would be so much more easy than these!
customer_reviews.author: playfulseekerandservant

customer_reviews.title: Blobs, smudges,not good like old style
customer_reviews.text: The old style Zebra pens with the clear barrel were great but these new style Zebra gel pens with the smoke colored barrels smudge, blob and the way the pen feels in your hsnd is different as well. They should bring back the old style. Even if we pay a little more it's worth it to get a better pen with better ink. I'm returning these black new style pens as I already bought the new style blue pens in the past and they're horrible as I stated.
customer_reviews.author: Mari G. H.

customer_reviews.title: Great smooth writing pen!
customer_reviews.text: Good value for a very smooth writing pen. Comfortable to use as I do a lot of writing. I didn't realize that each ink tip also has a small seal on it which will keep them long lasting as well. The quantity is handy as a lot of pens seem to disappear around my household for unknown reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Pens all blew up in my pants
customer_reviews.text: I work as a barback i keep 2-3 pens on me all the time to write down what to restock. During my workshift the 3 pens i put in my pocket burst. Never buying these again. Might give them to a server I dont like.
customer_reviews.author: Ant

customer_reviews.title: Short Messy Lifespan
customer_reviews.text: The pens I received needed coaxing to write, spilled ink if held in one place on the paper, spilled ink if left resting on a counter and usually stopped writing in mid word or smudged the word. I did not try all 24 of them but after 10 pens, I gave up and bought BIC. Before I bought BIC, I gathered all the Zebra pens and tossed them in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: rb

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded Expecations
customer_reviews.text: As a college student, I needed pens that worked smoothly and were comfortable in my hand for my long lectures. These pens exceeded my expectations. The grip is strong and the pen fits comfortably in my hand. I'm left-handed, so sometimes I have trouble with the way pencils/pens rest while I write, but I surprisingly had no issues with these. I've used these pens for a couple days now and I'm in love. For the price, these are a no-brainer. I will definitely be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You have to get the ink flowing each time you want to use the same pen
customer_reviews.text: I've tried four different pens from the pack and they all have the same issue. They don't work immediately when you need them. You go to write and nothing comes out at first until you draw on a scratch piece of paper or wet the tip of the pen. Then the pens will work great. But come back tomorrow and you'll have to repeat the same process. It is very frustrating that each pen acts like it is out of ink every time you want to use it, and you have to have grab scratch paper to doodle on to get ink flowing every single time you need to use the same pen -- very frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value
customer_reviews.text: Great value pen and perfect for throwaways/pens you don’t care about. Every so often the ink won’t come out right away, but 9/10 they write perfect. The value is outstanding and when they do work, they definitely write smooth. Not too much of a heavy flow of ink but more than a bic. Would definitely purchase again and they serve their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Nick S.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a pen that would write consistently on slick thermal receipt paper and these delivered. Most pens in this price range will get halfway through a word or signature on thermal paper and stop but these don't. The ink also dries quickly so they don't tend to smudge as easily as more expensive pens that are consistent on thermal paper, and they are cheap enough that I'm not upset when a customer takes off with my pen.
customer_reviews.author: Marius Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Great until you pick it back up again
customer_reviews.text: Like a few have already mentioned, these pens write great for the first few times you write with them. But after that they are the worst! Ink dries up and hard to write anything after that. Waste of money for sure. I thought it might be the first pen I used but it was every pen I pulled from this large pack! Frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Smooth, comfortable, long lasting.
customer_reviews.text: These are smooth, gel-like pens. I've used pilot g2s my whole life, but have recently switched to these. I like the metal clip which won't snap off easily like a plastic one. The tip has a plug you must remove before first use. Very comfortable to hold and wrong with all day. The are good for cold environments as well (I work in an office and a refrigerated environment). The only downside is that these sometimes get clogged or leak like the G2, but not nearly as often. Great pens, I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryne

customer_reviews.title: When they work, they're good. But they're not consistent
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a 24 count of pens, however, the quality is not as high as I'd like. I always have to keep 3 on my desk as they will "short out" mid-sentence, and I have to switch to another. A full scribbles and it'll come back, but this gets pretty annoying. Overall, OK but be ready for some minor frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Our Go-To Pens
customer_reviews.text: These pens are my go-to order when purchasing for my office. Fantastic value for excellent pens! They last a long time and my coworkers enjoy that they're nicer click pens with a grip. They don't know how affordable they are! They just think I spoil them with nice pens! We've ordered colored versions as well and enjoy those greatly too. You can't beat this for standard black pens though!
customer_reviews.author: K. L. Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Must have for waiters/waitresses
customer_reviews.text: Great pens, I’m a waitress and I love the metal clip on them because they never break off and I don’t have to worry about digging around in my apron for a pen I always have them pinned right on my apron. Makes life much easier. They also look more expensive than they are. They write smoothly and hold up very well so I definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pens
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these pens. I am a food server and we have to supply our own pens for our guests to sign their credit card slips. I love these pens for several reasons. 1) They are very good quality. 2) They are easy to write with. Most importantly, 3) they are inexpensive so when my guests walk away with them, I don't panic. I know I can always get more when they have all "walked away".
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best pens on the market - and I’m a pen snob!
customer_reviews.text: I’m kind of an office products junkie/snob, especially when it comes to writing instruments. After years of trying them all, I have to say that Zebra has the best writing pens on the market. I love these pens for their consistent ink delivery and comfort in writing with. This is a great deal on the best pens available in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: CarolinaMermaid

customer_reviews.title: Nice grip but pen does not write
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a ball point pen that wrote from the get go. This entire order works the same way. If you draw a three inch line, the first inch does not write. After that its fine, but that does not work for me. Nice grip and comfortable but does not write. STAY AWAY
customer_reviews.author: arthur conway

customer_reviews.title: Gloppy
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped this was the clear barrel plastic zebra pen I had purchased once before. This is the 2nd time I’ve purchased these specific pens. The ink tends to be gloppy. As a nurse, penmanship is essential to proper, legible and effective charting. This pen tends to leave ink globs on paper multiple time during my work day. For this reason, I won’t ever purchase these again. Maybe I mistook these pens for the ones I had bought the first time. And now I have some pens to give out to my patients when they need them.
customer_reviews.author: Lori D.

customer_reviews.title: Great, economic, working pen!
customer_reviews.text: Zebra's #1 selling pen gets the job done. If you need a conventional pen that is durable and comfortable to write with for the office or for any note taking, this pen is for you! It's smooth writing ink last and doesn't smudge, which is all I want from a pen. Definitely my go-to pen that I don't mind losing or sharing with coworkers because it comes in bulks and I can always get another pack for a great price! I enjoy using Zebra pens in general!
customer_reviews.author: Yessenia

customer_reviews.title: Great pens
customer_reviews.text: We use these at our restaurant. They write on receipt paper, which is sometimes waxy and greasy. They last longer than those Pilot G2's, which are good for a couple days. Customers often compliment the pens, and they eventually disappear...
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Killingfield

customer_reviews.title: Great pen, but...........
customer_reviews.text: If you play with it with your thumb & engage the point in & out, it will eventually come apart & you will have to sqush it back together again. I have bought the 24 pack many times & it happens to every one of them. Now I tape them together & keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Arrived quickly, carefully packaged, at a good price
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous product for people who write with ink pens all the time. We have a crossword addict who goes through pens like wind through a screen. The product is high quality, inexpensive , was shipped with care and arrived early.
customer_reviews.author: czs712

customer_reviews.title: I'm not very pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: I'm not very pleased with this product. Yes its cheap and for a low price. The quality of the pen is poor, and the dispensing of the ink is poor.The pen comes apart rather easily, while being used. It snaps in half without much effort. Good for taking notes, but each pen has failed or broke before one third of the ink is used. I will not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barr

customer_reviews.title: Easy to do
customer_reviews.text: The quality is not very good. The ink dries easily. You will not be able to write after stopping for a while. Stroke hard.
customer_reviews.author: ling

customer_reviews.title: Total garbage!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these pens before. Just got a pack this year (2020). These pens sit in a cup, upright all day every day. They constantly need to be scribbled before ink comes out. Every. Single. Time. Total garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Hulk Brogan

customer_reviews.title: Good for office work
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I have been doing a huge amount of office work and these are great when I need to do that work. Writes non stop unlike other pens that you have to scramble around on an extra piece of paper just to get a few letters written down. Also writes good on semi gloss papers such as time-cards with ease. Thank you for saving me the frustration of having to waist time.
customer_reviews.author: John L

customer_reviews.title: These are the nice pens everyone loves to write with
customer_reviews.text: These pens perfectly glide without having to press down. Nice clicking pens that don't break and aren't cheap looking. Buy these for the man in your life that wears a work shirt or polo and always has a pen tucked in somewhere. They'll appreciate not having to mess with a pen cap and he'll have the "nice pen" compared to everyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need to press down to knock off tip before using ink.
customer_reviews.text: I know I threw a couple of pens away but don't do that. They are shipped with a small tip which I assume is to keep it from drying out. Just press down a little to knock it off and then the pen works great.
customer_reviews.author: CBack

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. Big waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't go back & write a bad review. But these are the worst pens I have ever used. They don't last more than two to three days, if your lucky. But today it didn't last more than an hour! Please don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Seems dry at first
customer_reviews.text: I could have sent these back thinking it was old stock..and it could be, but I kept scribbling on all sides of the nib until the ink came through. It’s a good deal for ball point, so don’t give up immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Bedding

customer_reviews.title: Good little pens!
customer_reviews.text: These are great little pens. Sometimes you have to give them a little "scribble" to get them going, but it's not bad at all and I'm picky about pens that don't perform. After that they write great! Very smooth, like a fine-point pen would write. Happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Wray

customer_reviews.title: Great pens, haven't tested them in the long run, but seems to do the job
customer_reviews.text: Love the price, and having a whole bunch of them. It is such a good feeling to open the box and have a whole bunch of pens and know they should last a long time, and put some in the car, in the desk, in the other desk and in some bags of goods just in case. Somehow the pens just disappear and only a few end up staying around.
customer_reviews.author: Janishasha

customer_reviews.title: Love These Pens
customer_reviews.text: After using many different types of pens, I find these pens work perfectly for me. Smooth, easy writing, stroke is not too thick and not overly fine. My handwriting is not as strong as it used to be. These are really perfect.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: These are pens
customer_reviews.text: Good deal for 24 pens that I'm always losing or breaking. Now I have pens everywhere especially when I'm always looking for a pen at the right moment. Now I got one in the kitchen, bedroom, living room and garage and my vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Art Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Z grip is the worst ballpoint pen brand I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: The ink in the brand new pens did not come out. When I did extensive scribbling to see if the pens would write, some ink would come out after much effort, but the ink flow was uneven. I will never buy them again and do not recommend them to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: nicola miller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These pens are great for me, I need pens that are t too thin & that write very smoothly. I lost function in my hand so writing is very difficult & painful. I don’t have fine motor ability for very thin pens and the smoothness effects my hand too, if it drags or something it hurts more. Again these are great, plus they don’t bleed through.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Ford

customer_reviews.title: Pens fall apart
customer_reviews.text: 3 of my pens came apart into 5 pieces, with no cracking. I could not figure out how to reassemble. The pens did perform well before they disassembled. I keep the pens in a passport purse with my iPhone in a pen pocket so they would be subject to some pressure. I wear the purse every day.
customer_reviews.author: U. Stuart Auslander

customer_reviews.title: not even close to the smoothest pen ever
customer_reviews.text: I love pens. I am very particular about pens. The packaging stated that these are the smoothest pen ever. I was sorely disappointed. I could easily offer up at least 5 better options. The Bic Atlantis Velocity is the real recipient of the smoothest pen ever. I just took these to work as bounty for all the pen thieves.
customer_reviews.author: Cheri Miehe

customer_reviews.title: I like the ink flow and print density
customer_reviews.text: great value and I prefer this kind of pen for the print density and easy ink flow. The medium tip with the black ink makes a very bold print with little pressure. recommend and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bobcat

customer_reviews.title: Average quality
customer_reviews.text: These work just fine, but the quality is low compared to pilot (which is what I normally use). I write a lot and my hand gets tired quickly when I use these. The price is great, but you certainly get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Tica

customer_reviews.title: NOT GEL.
customer_reviews.text: I did a search for gel pens and these showed up mingled within the gel, and I picked them. Not good quality. Not worth returning. They're just sitting in a drawer. Had to go back and purchase the gel pens.
customer_reviews.author: Ray C.

customer_reviews.title: I dont know if I got a bad batch but these pens are horrible. Z-grip black 1.0mm medium point
customer_reviews.text: These pens write great until they dont. they just stop working. I have to scribble on something to get them to write again. I threw so many pens away thinking I just had a bad apple in the bunch. But so far I havent had one pen that doesnt suffer from this issue... I like Zebra's but these are bad.
customer_reviews.author: Tribalvision

customer_reviews.title: Great price pan for office use
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 pack of this pans for the office. We been using G2 for awhile. But we found that our employees always lost their pan. Anyway, the price for these pan is perfect for what we needed. And the quantity we got from the package is way more than what we got from the G2. Great value if you not looking for highest quality pan.
customer_reviews.author: Frankie L

customer_reviews.title: OLD PRODUCT?! Don’t Buy! Skip terribly!
customer_reviews.text: These MUST BE OLD; DON’T BUY! I knew the package wouldn’t be perfect, but NOT PENS that SKIP CONSTANTLY. These are name brand good pens that write beautifully - unless they are OLD merchandise. BIG WASTE of $$! Can’t return; threw messed up packaging away & not worth trouble. What a waste of money. Thought merchandise would be NEW - NOT OLD PENS THAT SKIP SO BAD CAN BARELY WRITE HALF THE TIME. VERY DISAPPOINTED; should have received pens I have used many times in store purchases & always write beautifully when “fresh” merchandise! Don’t buy this pen “deal!”
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better pens out there
customer_reviews.text: If I don't use it for a day, the ink dries up and it takes a bit of rolling before it starts, leaving a dried ball of ink on the nib, which I have to wipe off. Never had this problem with any other rolling ball pens.
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pens
customer_reviews.text: These pens write very smoothly and they are cheap so if I loose one at school it isn't the end of the world and I won't be upset about it. I highly recommend if you are a student or just need a high quality inexpensive pen.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t start writing right away
customer_reviews.text: Good pen when it actually starts writing. I have to scribble and struggle every time I need to use one. The ink doesn’t start flowing right away. It can be very frustrating when I’m busy at work since I’m a server. I’m going out and buying a different set today
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Ink blobs
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for work. I thought they would be good as I write a lot and have a lot of clients that also need to write a lot. Every time I go to write something, there is a blob of black ink that never fails to smear. I would only buy these again if they were free.
customer_reviews.author: Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because ink bleeds at the pen tip causing build up. I have to constantly wipe the tip clean before writing. Other than that it writes smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Searider94

customer_reviews.title: The new ridged grip is uncomfortable, painful even :(
customer_reviews.text: let me start by saying that i love zebra pens, they are my favorite with regard to how they write... unfortunately, they have "upgraded" their grips, and i hate it. the new ridged grip is very uncomfortable, even painful for me. I do a lot of writing at work, will need to look at another solution.
customer_reviews.author: DionCristo

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Have wax over the ends to prevent leakage before first use. Don't love the way they write. Not very smooth. Difficult to get started with ink flow each use.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Total crap
customer_reviews.text: These are nothing but junk. You spend more time ,trying to get the ink to come out, than the actual ,writing. I have not had one write, concictantly, yet. The ones at the Dollar Tree work a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Bartholomew

customer_reviews.title: Use to engrave your writing surface since that is easier to do than apply ink.
customer_reviews.text: These are terrible because each pen is completely dry when first using on every use. I need to gouge the writing surface with several scratches before ink is applied. Even after the first use, this action is required for every use. Bought these as a back up. Waited about 4 months before use. Now I'm outside the sellers window. I'm scrapping these and never buying from this seller again. I don't know how long they've stocked but this was robbery. Please don't stock old crap. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: I have so many pens now.
customer_reviews.text: This one pack is so many pens. I’m drowning in them, it’s awesome. I have enough to put like 3 pens everywhere; my purse, backpack, home desk, work desk, drawers, nightstand, kitchen. I’m loaded with pens.
customer_reviews.author: Ashton & Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The highlight of these Zebra Z-Grip pens is definitely the quality of the ink. Surprisingly so smooth and after writing I swiped my finger across the ink and it was already dry. He ink doesn't bleed which means these pens will last a very long time. Another thing is the metal clip which is great for durability! The no slip grip is a plus of course especially when needing to scribble something down fast! What I love the most though is the look of the pen, nice and sleek, not bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Heamen I Slats

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre pen quality
customer_reviews.text: I unfortunately don't like these pens they skip and you have to go back and write again. I bought them for a corporate meeting and tried them and disappointed. I think I should have bought the papermate.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Lily Boyd

customer_reviews.title: worst writing pens ever.
customer_reviews.text: You need an extra piece of paper to use these. One to write, the other to scribble until the damn things work for 2-3 letters, than scribble some more. In the trash, waste of my money!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Lotts of great pens!
customer_reviews.text: Yall just get these, they are pens and if you need pens, these are the pens to get. Good enough quality for 24 and under $10. I have 18 left and I keep losing them at my work so this pack is perfect for my bad habits.
customer_reviews.author: Zane

customer_reviews.title: Cheap pens
customer_reviews.text: Cheap pens. They don't write smooth.Zebra makes a lot of good pens but these aren't one of them. You do get a lot of these bad pens for a low price though.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Dry out after a couple weeks
customer_reviews.text: The tips dry out after a couple weeks. I'm in a dry climate (Arizona), and the pens stop working after a couple weeks after first, light, use. Plenty of ink left in the pens.
customer_reviews.author: JJAbba

customer_reviews.title: They skip & ink flow is poor.
customer_reviews.text: Nice feel, and they write well right after you remove the glue ball on the tip. After that, you'll have to write a little, maybe a lot to get the ink flowing again. I'm a delivery driver so this doesn't work at all for me. Customers tend to be irritated when the pen doesn't work when they want to write in a tip.
customer_reviews.author: BradMorrison

customer_reviews.title: NOT a comfort grip
customer_reviews.text: I have to write a lot and wanted a comfortable, easy flowing pen. Said it was all that with the comfort grips. NOT COMFORT. Makes my fingers and whole hand hurt. I will have to go to Wal-Mart and buy different pens. NOT HAPPY.
customer_reviews.author: moira

customer_reviews.title: Great Pens, Good value!
customer_reviews.text: (The ratings do not indicate performance of the pen itself - how it Writes). I am very pleased with these pens. I write a lot and they last me a whole year plus. Writing - smooth, great. The reason I did not give a 5 star is that my second purchase pens are smudging a bit. They may be older stock. People, Buy these! They write great and Good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than others!!
customer_reviews.text: These pens surprisingly feel much better (sturdier, better quality) than their PaperMate equivalents. As a server, I need to replace pens quite often. While I used to get the PaperMate ones, I am switching over to these because they are amazing (and cheaper too lol)!
customer_reviews.author: Margarita

customer_reviews.title: Returned pens.
customer_reviews.text: In order to use this pen, it was necessary to keep a scratch pad handy. The ink would not flow until you gave the pen a good scribble on a scratch pad. I had tried three of the pens in the pack before returning them.
customer_reviews.author: S. Price

customer_reviews.title: Quality Pens!
customer_reviews.text: Really good pens especially for the price. Package was easy to open. It writes smooth, easy flow, and dries fast, so no smudging problems. Size and grip is comfortable. I've tried seven pens from the package, and the quality is consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Ava B

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable Value
customer_reviews.text: I've started attending nursing school and obviously need quite a few pens to keep me stocked. Seeing a 24 pack of pens for only $7 puts it at about 25-30 cents per pen and this is an insane value. This may lead you to believe that the pens are cheap or disposable. They're far from it and were very good pens especially when you consider the total price.
customer_reviews.author: Kingfury4

customer_reviews.title: Skips When Writing
customer_reviews.text: It is a good feel and look, but virtually every time I go to use it I have to scribble first to get the ink working and depending on the surface may or may not write cleanly. I don't get it, other cheap pens I have laying around or got for free write instantly and oftentimes write on the surface cleanly that this pen failed to do. I would NOT recommend this pen.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M

customer_reviews.title: Stops writing
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if this was a bad batch or the reviews that we're good were not legit, but these pens write terribly. I constantly have to stop and scribble with them to get the ink going again. Not happy with these, and usually I like a Zebra.
customer_reviews.author: tmetzgar

customer_reviews.title: Front End Threading Deteriorates Immediately
customer_reviews.text: The plastic threading that lines the front "cap" of the pen deteriorates quickly and makes the front part of the pen fall off. The user is left tightening this cap constantly to keep the pen operational. This happens so soon in the life of the pen that you will spend the majority of your experience with this fatal design flaw harassing you as you write. I am very disappointed that I bought 24 of these pens.
customer_reviews.author: Garret Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great long lasting pens!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite pens! I love these pens, I found one when I was at work one day and I had to go out and buy them after that! I have put one in all areas of my house and school bags and desk area. These write so well and I love the feel of them, the grip is really nice and they are very long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Madison H

customer_reviews.title: Could have been assembled better as the ball end just barely sticks out beyond ...
customer_reviews.text: Works for everyday use, but does not always start flowing ink. Some of them appear to have a plastic cover over the end that has to be removed. Could have been assembled better as the ball end just barely sticks out beyond the shell.
customer_reviews.author: FLMJ Goodyear

product_meta.title: Zebra Pen Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pen, Medium Point, 1.0mm, Black Ink - 24 Pieces (Packaging may vary)
product_meta.description: Size:24 PackLooking for an everyday tool that doesn’t look or perform like one? The Z-Grip Ballpoint Retractable Pen delivers on all fronts: value, performance, comfort, and style. There's no need to compromise on any of the attributes you like in your pens as the Z-Grip Retractable Ballpoint Pen features silky smooth easy-glide ink for a skip-less writing experience, a comfort ridged grip and a metal clip for durability. Housed in a plastic barrel with a fun, fashionable look and retractable design, this ballpoint pen is the perfect choice for your home, school, workspace, small business, or traditional office. You'll feel the difference when you write, but not at the cash register. This pen set includes 24 non-refillable ballpoint pens with black ink.
feature_bullets: 1.0mm medium point ballpoint pen for everyday, heavy usage featuring low viscosity black ink for a smooth, skip-less writing experience and quicker writing speeds
Housed in a stylish plastic barrel with a soft, latex-free rubberized grip that provides increased comfort for continuous writing and a better grasp for taking quick notes
Features a convenient metal pocket clip for quick access and easy transportation⁠; Attach it to your clipboard, folder, or padfolio to ensure you never lose your favorite pen again
Bold black ink combined with solid pen construction make this high-performing ballpoint pen a perfect choice for your home, school, workspace, small business, or traditional office
Pen set includes 24 non-refillable ballpoint pens that deliver on all fronts—value, performance, comfort, and style—so you can get the job done right every single time
